products.label: IBM Cloudability Enablement
products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-cloudability
products.short_description: Add your IBM Cloud account to IBM Cloudability and start analyzing and tracking your cloud expenses.
products.long_description:
Simplify the onboarding of your IBM Cloud account to IBM Cloudability with this deployable architecture (DA). All of the necessary steps to get your IBM Cloud billing data into IBM Cloudability are managed for you using infrastructure as code (IaC). This includes the following:

1. Creating a Key Protect encrypted Object Storage buckets to store your billing reports.
2. Enabling IBM Cloud to write billing reports to the bucket daily.
3. Grant IBM Cloudability access to read the reports from the bucket
4. Add your IBM Cloud account to Cloudability.
5. Verify that the IBM Cloud integration with Cloudability is successful.

Your IBM Cloud billing data will begin showing up in IBM Cloudability the next day. 
To get started [create your access credentials](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-planning) and then [deploy the deployable architecture with projects](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-deploy-cloud) . 
If you don't have an IBM Cloudability account then start by creating your [free trial](https://www.apptio.com/products/cloudability/#cldy-trial).

features.title: Automatic updates of your IBM Cloud billing reports in a Object Storage Bucket
features.description: Cloudability reads CSV billing reports from an Object Storage bucket for each account in your enterprise. The billing reports are updated on a daily basis.

features.title: Secured with Key Protect
features.description: Your Object Storage bucket which contains your accounts billing reports is encrypted with a Key Protect encryption key with automated rotation. See [encrypting a bucket with Key Protect](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-tutorial-kp-encrypt-bucket) for more details.

features.title: Least Privileged Operations to Cloudability
features.description: Custom access roles are created so that Cloudability only has the minimal required access that it needs to integrate with your IBM Cloud Account.

features.title: Analyze your cloud expenses for all accounts in an Enterprise
features.description: Deploying in your main Enterprise account will automatically add any existing and future accounts in your enterprise to IBM Cloudability allowing you to track and analyze your entire enterprises cloud expenses in Cloudability.

profiles.profile_name: IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services

diagrams.description: Billing reports are written to a Key Protect encrypted object storage bucket. IBM Cloudability is granted access to read from this bucket. Your IBM Cloud account is added to Cloudability so that it knows how to read the data from the object storage bucket.

See [configuring IBM Cloud IAM permissions](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-planning#cloudability-iam-prereqs)

Cloudability API Key used to add the IBM Cloud account to Cloudability. See [how to retrieve your Cloudability API key](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-planning#api-key) or visit the [cloudability preferences page](https://app.apptio.com/cloudability#/settings/preferences). Setting this value to `__NULL__ `will skip adding the IBM Cloud account to Cloudability allowing the IBM Cloud Account to be added to Cloudability manually.
